entries.meaning: Rebuilding or restructuring; large scale repair or renewal.
examples: The conversion of so many old industrial buildings into living quarters was a major factor in the regeneration.

entries.meaning: (theology) Spiritual rebirth; the change from a carnal or material life to a pious one
(Christianity) The renewal of the world at the second coming of Christ.
The process by which a water softener flushes out minerals extracted from the water supply.
(role-playing games, fantasy) The ability to rapidly heal substantial physical damage to one's body, or to spontaneously restore hit points.
examples: The standard ring of regeneration restores one point of damage per turn (and will eventually replace lost limbs or organs).
